question: Question_12_(a)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

A system of 4 linear equations in 3 variables is always inconsistent.
sols:
\textbf{False} - defining âinconsistentâ as related to linear
dependence, if you have four equations with only three variables, there
are only two possibilities: In the no solution case, the system is
inconsistent

i.e. $x_1 + 2x_2 = 3$ and $x_1 + 3x_3 = 3$However, in the case that

$x + y + z = 3$ $x = 1$ $y = 1$ $z = 1$

The system is consistent.
